content.en: Framework optimization: Scientists are using algorithms to help identify high-performing metal-organic frameworks for various applications, such as methane purification, carbon capture, and gas separation. These algorithms, including quantitative structure-property relationship models, machine learning techniques, and computational screening, are able to analyze large amounts of data and make predictions about the performance of different frameworks. By combining computational analysis with experimental studies, researchers hope to discover new materials that can improve processes like methane storage, CO2 capture, and gas separation.
content.da: Rammeoptimering: Forskere bruger algoritmer til at hjælpe med at identificere højtydende metal-organiske rammer til forskellige anvendelser, såsom methanrensning, kulstoffangst og gasseparation. Disse algoritmer, herunder kvantitative struktur-egenskabs-forholdsmodeller, maskinlæringsteknikker og beregningsscreening, er i stand til at analysere store mængder data og forudsige ydeevnen af forskellige rammer. Ved at kombinere beregningsanalyse med eksperimentelle studier håber forskerne at opdage nye materialer, der kan forbedre processer som methanlagring, CO2-fangst og gasseparation.
